# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here's a function that does exactly that:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth!(df)
    df[:ym] = Dates.year.(df[:dt]) * 100 .+ Dates.month.(df[:dt])
    return df
end
```

This function modifies the input DataFrame `df` by adding a new column `ym` with the desired year-month format. The `Dates.year` and `Dates.month` functions extract the year and month from the DateTime objects, respectively. Then, the year is multiplied by 100 and added to the month to create the desired format.

You can use this function like this:

```julia
julia> using DataFrames, Dates

julia> df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime("2022-01-01"), DateTime("2022-12-31")])
2×1 DataFrame
 Row │ dt
     │ DateTime
─────┼────────────
   1 │ 2022-01-01
   2 │ 2022-12-31

julia> add_yearmonth!(df)
2×2 DataFrame
 Row │ dt             │ ym
     │ DateTime       │ Int64
─────┼────────────────┼─────
   1 │ 2022-01-01     │ 202201
   2 │ 2022-12-31     │ 202212
```

If you prefer a function that returns a new DataFrame instead of modifying the input, you can create a copy of the input DataFrame and modify that:

```julia
function add_yearmonth(df)
    df_copy = copy(df)
    df_copy[:ym] = Dates.year.(df_copy[:dt]) * 100 .+ Dates.month.(df_copy[:dt])
    return df_copy
end
```

This function works similarly to the previous one but creates a new DataFrame instead of modifying the input:

```julia
julia> df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime("2022-01-01"), DateTime("2022-12-31")])
2×1 DataFrame
 Row │ dt
     │ DateTime
─────┼────────────
   1 │ 2022-01-01
   2 │ 2022-12-31

julia> new_df = add_yearmonth(df)
2×2 DataFrame
 Row │ dt             │ ym
     │ DateTime       │ Int64
─────┼────────────────┼─────
   1 │ 2022-01-01     │ 202201
   2 │ 2022-12-31     │ 202212

julia> df
2×1 DataFrame
 Row │ dt
     │ DateTime
─────┼────────────
   1 │ 2022-01-01
   2 │ 2022-12-31
```
